**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
ceph-osd-prepare fails to detect lvm2 in versions <= 2.02.168-2 ([Debian Stretch](https://packages.debian.org/stretch/lvm2))

**Expected behavior:**
ceph-osd-prepare detects lvm2 in older versions as well

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
Install cluster example in Debian Stretch with lvm2 v2.02.168-2

**File(s) to submit**:


* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
* Operator's logs, if necessary
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary
logs: 
```
2020-08-12 07:31:09.623970 I | rookcmd: starting Rook v1.3.0-beta.0.825.g9c23522 with arguments '/rook/rook ceph osd provision'                                                                                                                                                                          │
2020-08-12 07:31:09.624026 I | rookcmd: flag values: --cluster-id=0d3b15f2-6fad-40a9-851c-50cb53928769, --data-device-filter=all, --data-device-path-filter=, --data-devices=, --drive-groups=, --encrypted-device=false, --force-format=false, --help=false, --location=, --log-flush-frequency=5s, --l │
2020-08-12 07:31:09.624031 I | op-mon: parsing mon endpoints: a=100.66.23.142:6789,b=100.66.176.248:6789,c=100.67.67.98:6789                                                                                                                                                                             │
2020-08-12 07:31:09.630659 I | op-osd: CRUSH location=root=default host=ip-172-20-60-196-us-west-2-compute-internal region=us-west-2 zone=us-west-2a                                                                                                                                                     │
2020-08-12 07:31:09.630675 I | cephcmd: crush location of osd: root=default host=ip-172-20-60-196-us-west-2-compute-internal region=us-west-2 zone=us-west-2a                                                                                                                                            │
2020-08-12 07:31:09.630691 D | exec: Running command: nsenter --mount=/rootfs/proc/1/ns/mnt -- /usr/sbin/lvm --help                                                                                                                                                                                      │
2020-08-12 07:31:09.631748 D | cephosd: failed to call nsenter. failed to execute nsenter. output: nsenter: failed to execute /usr/sbin/lvm: No such file or directory: exit status 127                                                                                                                  │
2020-08-12 07:31:09.631764 D | exec: Running command: nsenter --mount=/rootfs/proc/1/ns/mnt -- /sbin/lvm --help                                                                                                                                                                                          │
2020-08-12 07:31:09.634725 D | cephosd: failed to call nsenter. failed to execute nsenter. output: Udev is running and DM_DISABLE_UDEV environment variable is set. Bypassing udev, LVM will manage logical volume symlinks in device directory.                                                          │
  Udev is running and DM_DISABLE_UDEV environment variable is set. Bypassing udev, LVM will obtain device list by scanning device directory.                                                                                                                                                             │
  No such command.  Try 'help'.: exit status 2                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           │
2020-08-12 07:31:09.634848 I | op-k8sutil: format and nodeName longer than 63 chars, nodeName ip-172-20-60-196.us-west-2.compute.internal will be 505227a4259206d6686a689b4926f75f                                                                                                                       │
binary "lvm" does not exist on the host, make sure lvm2 package is installed: binary "lvm" does not exist on the host 
```

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): 
```
PRETTY_NAME="Debian GNU/Linux 9 (stretch)"
NAME="Debian GNU/Linux"
VERSION_ID="9"
VERSION="9 (stretch)"
VERSION_CODENAME=stretch
```
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
```
1 SMP Debian 4.9.228-1 (2020-07-05) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod):
```
rook: v1.3.0-beta.0.825.g9c23522
go: go1.13.8
```
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`):
```
ceph version 15.2.4 (7447c15c6ff58d7fce91843b705a268a1917325c) octopus (stable)
```
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift):
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)):

* Possible fix:
The error is caused because in previous versions of lvm, the command 'help' should be written without `--`. 
Thus, in [this line](https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/52a60716f7bdf49d06070346e0d1a9bbe7f33076/pkg/daemon/ceph/osd/daemon.go#L176) the command to check is lvm command exists should remove `--` from the argument to ensure compatibility with older versions.
title: ceph-osd-prepare fails to detect lvm2 in versions <= 2.02.168-2
